body:
So earlier today I got my first ban. Im not writing to appeal, but to say I am sorry for what I did. I was banned for a day for combat logging. I didn't combat log because I was about to die, but I logged out because I had to go. In future I will just wait till I die before logging out.

Thanks for reading anyway.
body_tagged:

title: My first ban.

replies.body: I have respect for people who knowledge their mistakes and say sorry, those are the people that I know who will never do it again
replies.body_tagged: I have respect for people who knowledge their mistakes and say sorry, those are the people that I know who will never do it again

replies.body: Very nice of you to apologize, even if you didn't do anything severe.
replies.body_tagged: Very nice of you to apologize, even if you didn't do anything severe.

replies.body: No need to feel sorry for him, wait out the ban like a mam then come back
replies.body_tagged: No need to feel sorry for him, wait out the ban like a mam then come back

replies.body: That seems a bit excessive... I combat logged once before by accident (long story) and recieved a kick (idek why it wasnt a warn but a kick??)

replies.body: I don't understand why they punish for it if you accidentally do it once. It should only be punishable when you do it often, not when a moderator happens to notice that they didn't kill you. They just automatically assume that you logged off because you didn't want to die.
replies.body_tagged: I don't understand why they punish for it if you accidentally do it once. It should only be punishable when you do it often, not when a moderator happens to notice that they didn't kill you. They just automatically assume that you logged off because you didn't want to die.

replies.body: It should be a warn IMO, but we don't always get our own way.
